definition[0]: to express the feelings, thoughts, or beliefs of a person or group of people
example[0]: Dan, speaking for the students, started the meeting.
definition[1]: used to tell someone that you do not have the same opinion as they do, or that something that is true for them is not true for you
example[1]: ‘We don’t want to go.’ ‘Speak for yourself!’
definition[2]: if something or someone is spoken for, they have already been promised to someone else
example[2]: They’re all either married or spoken for.
